citations.narrative:
The water receptacles for the capybara, raccoons and foxes are in need of cleaning. These species have only one source
of drinking water in their enclosure which consists of a large pool of water. No separate potable drinking water sources
are present. The pool of water for the capybara had fecal material and dirt in the bottom of it and the water was murky.
Capybara naturally choose to defecate in water. The pool in the raccoon enclosure had green algae material growing on
the sides and bottom and the water was murky. The water in the pool for the foxes appeared clear but had dirt in it. The
pools of water in these enclosures appear to be used by the animals for bathing, cooling down and defecating. These
actions can lead to contamination of the water which then may no longer be potable or may acquire a taste that keeps the
animals from drinking it.
All water receptacles used to provide drinking/potable water must be kept clean and sanitary. Correct by 8/17/24.

The barn in the large enclosure housing sheep, goats, llama and pigs is in need of cleaning. The shavings on the floor of
the inside of the barn and under the roofed 'porch' area are uniformly mixed through with fecal material throughout. The
animals resting in the barn cannot avoid contact with the dirty shavings. Excreta should be removed regularly to prevent
contamination of the animals, spread of disease and odors.
Correct by 8/20/24.

The room being used to store and prepare food, store enrichment items and other miscellaneous items such as towels is
in need of cleaning. There is dust on most surfaces along with cobwebs on some of the items on the upper shelves. The
counters are dirty with emptied food bags on it. The full trash can has no lid and has a number of flies buzzing around it.
Items on the shelves and some on the floor are stacked haphazardly and with overcrowding making it difficult to keep the
areas clean and pest free. Dirty towels in an open hamper has flies buzzing around it. The fly strips are full and need to be
replaced. The premises including the buildings need to be kept clean and organized in order to facilitate the required
cleaning, to prevent odors/pests/spread of disease and to reduce the risk of contamination of the feed. The premises
including the buildings must be kept clean and accumulations of trash must be placed in designated areas and cleared as
necessary. Correct by 8/21/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with two facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The water receptacles for the capybara, raccoons and foxes are in need of cleaning. These species have only one source 
of drinking water in their enclosure which consists of a large pool of water. No separate potable drinking water sources 
are present. The pool of water for the capybara had fecal material and dirt in the bottom of it and the water was murky. 
Capybara naturally choose to defecate in water. The pool in the raccoon enclosure had green algae material growing on 
the sides and bottom and the water was murky. The water in the pool for the foxes appeared clear but had dirt in it. The 
pools of water in these enclosures appear to be used by the animals for bathing, cooling down and defecating. These 
actions can lead to contamination of the water which then may no longer be potable or may acquire a taste that keeps the 
animals from drinking it.  
All water receptacles used to provide drinking/potable water must be kept clean and sanitary. Correct by 8/17/24. 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
The barn in the large enclosure housing sheep, goats, llama and pigs is in need of cleaning. The shavings on the floor of 
the inside of the barn and under the roofed 'porch' area are uniformly mixed through with fecal material throughout. The 
animals resting in the barn cannot avoid contact with the dirty shavings. Excreta should be removed regularly to prevent 
contamination of the animals, spread of disease and odors.  
Correct by 8/20/24. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The room being used to store and prepare food, store enrichment items and other miscellaneous items such as towels is 
in need of cleaning. There is dust on most surfaces along with cobwebs on some of the items on the upper shelves. The 
counters are dirty with emptied food bags on it. The full trash can has no lid and has a number of flies buzzing around it. 
Items on the shelves and some on the floor are stacked haphazardly and with overcrowding making it difficult to keep the 
areas clean and pest free. Dirty towels in an open hamper has flies buzzing around it. The fly strips are full and need to be 
replaced. The premises including the buildings need to be kept clean and organized in order to facilitate the required 
cleaning, to prevent odors/pests/spread of disease and to reduce the risk of contamination of the feed. The premises

including the buildings must be kept clean and accumulations of trash must be placed in designated areas and cleared as 
necessary. Correct by 8/21/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with two facility representatives.
